channel.title: CVE Feed for Red Hat -- undertow
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Red Hat -- undertow

item.title: CVE-2018-1114|2024-08-05T03:51:48.638Z -- red%20hat -- undertow
item.description: It was found that URLResource.getLastModified() in Undertow closes the file descriptors only when they are finalized which can cause file descriptors to exhaust. This leads to a file handler leak.

item.title: CVE-2018-14642|2024-08-05T09:38:12.577Z -- red%20hat -- undertow
item.description: An information leak vulnerability was found in Undertow. If all headers are not written out in the first write() call then the code that handles flushing the buffer will always write out the full contents of the writevBuffer buffer, which may contain data from previous requests.

item.title: CVE-2019-14888|2024-08-05T00:26:39.131Z -- red%20hat -- undertow
item.description: A vulnerability was found in the Undertow HTTP server in versions before 2.0.28.SP1 when listening on HTTPS. An attacker can target the HTTPS port to carry out a Denial Of Service (DOS) to make the service unavailable on SSL.
